unnormalised: ## Ditch the CDs, Folks: Why Music Streaming is Ruling the Entertainment Scene!
normalised: ## ditch the compact discs, folks: why music streaming is ruling the entertainment scene!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Remember the days of meticulously burning CDs and painstakingly curating playlists? Yeah, those days feel like a lifetime ago, right? Today, the entertainment world, especially when it comes to music, is dominated by the magic of streaming. And honestly, I'm not complaining!
normalised: hey everyone! remember the days of meticulously burning compact discs and painstakingly curating playlists? yeah, those days feel like a lifetime ago, right? today, the entertainment world, especially when it comes to music, is dominated by the magic of streaming. and honestly, i am not complaining!

unnormalised: Think about it. You're stuck in Bengaluru traffic, a solid 10 km crawl on Hosur Road. Instead of getting stressed, you can just whip out your phone and access literally millions of songs on platforms like Spotify, JioSaavn, or Gaana. From the latest Bollywood chartbusters like something from the new Karan Johar film to some classic Carnatic music, it's all right there at your fingertips. No more lugging around a bulky CD player or worrying about scratches ruining your favourite Lata Mangeshkar track.

unnormalised: The convenience is just unbeatable. I mean, who needs to remember the exact track name when you can just search "Punjabi wedding playlist" and instantly have access to a ready-made party soundtrack? Plus, these platforms are constantly updating their algorithms to suggest new music based on your listening habits. That’s how I discovered a whole genre of Rajasthani folk music I never knew existed! It's like having a personal music curator constantly introducing you to new sounds.

unnormalised: Even institutions like IIT Bombay are getting in on the streaming game. They’ve started offering workshops on music production and distribution, recognizing the growing importance of these platforms in the music industry.

unnormalised: And let's not forget the sheer volume of music available. You could spend your entire life exploring different genres and artists and still not scratch the surface. For a measly Rs. 99 a month, you get access to more music than you could ever possibly listen to. It's a steal!

unnormalised: The ability to create and share playlists is another awesome feature. You can curate the perfect soundtrack for any occasion, from a relaxing evening chai to a high-energy workout session. Share it with your friends, discover new playlists created by others – the possibilities are endless!
